definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
to whom the deer falls (idiom); the one to emerge victor (i.e. to seize the empire)/prize winner/champion
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
He laughs best who laughs last.
pinyin: shei2 xiao4 dao4 zui4 hou4 , shei2 xiao4 de2 zui4 hao3
containing_words.word: 谁笑到最后，谁笑得最好

definition: He laughs best who laughs last.

sentences.english: Still, who are we to say that we can stay?
sentences.chinese: 然而，谁有敢说我们能长留此地？

sentences.english: Who cut the strings, so Duanchang impact of the song.
sentences.chinese: 是谁剪断了琴弦，弹着如此断肠的曲。

sentences.english: Who make you mushroom so late, the whole ruddy blood temple you this hour equitable obtain up.
sentences.chinese: 谁让你起得这么晚，整个赤血宫就你这个时辰才起床。

sentences.english: And who can argue with Orwell?
sentences.chinese: 谁可以跟奥维尔争论呢？

sentences.english: Tom is an easygoing type of person who gets along well with everyone.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是那种随和的人，跟谁都合得来。

sentences.english: People seem to sense who is powerful.
sentences.chinese: 人们似乎凭感觉就知道谁拥有权力。

sentences.english: The woman behind me, whoever she is, whispers about sedatives.
sentences.chinese: 我后面的女人，不知道是谁，悄声说着镇静药。

sentences.english: Who would have thought a pansy could be such a naughty little flower.
sentences.chinese: 谁曾想到一三色堇可能是这样一个顽皮的花。

sentences.english: Who speaks words that are lovelier than those of Jesus?
sentences.chinese: 有谁说的话比耶稣更动听？

sentences.english: Think about it: who needs whom?
sentences.chinese: 想想，到底是谁离不开谁？

sentences.english: Think about it: who needs whom?
sentences.chinese: 想想，到底是谁离不开谁？

sentences.english: Some glorious morn--but when? Ah, who shall say?
sentences.chinese: 光荣的黎明，谁能说何时出现？

sentences.english: As with the Wal-Mart dream, I know better.
sentences.chinese: 就像谁人沃尔玛的梦那样，我就晓得。

sentences.english: No one could account for the fact that one of the boxes was extremely heavy.
sentences.chinese: 此中有只箱子特别重，可谁也弄不清是怎么回事。

definition: particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?")/particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?")/particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?")/(at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action/particle indicating strong affirmation
(emphatic sentence-final particle, used instead of 啊[a5] after a word ending in "n")
which? (interrogative, followed by classifier or numeral-classifier)
you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
finally/in the end/when all is said and done/after all/to the end/to the last
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
variant of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
youngest/most junior/tiny/one (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers, esp. on telephone or in military)/one or ace on dice or dominoes/variant of 吆[yao1], to shout
I would like to ask (usually used rhetorically)/one might well ask
how much?/how many?/(phone number, student ID etc) what number?
